intro: Pedicularis gaudinii, commonly known as the golden lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes hemiparasitic plants that derive some of their nutrients from host plants. The species is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, often on rocky slopes or in meadows. The plant's unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native environments.
